description: These soft and cakey drop cookies are easy to make and only require a handful of basic ingredients.
headline: Classic 1920s Orange Drop Cookies

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Store the cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.Recipe adapted from Aunt Sammyâ€™s Radio Recipes, published in 1927.

name: Classic 1920s Orange Drop Cookies
recipeIngredient: Cooking spray or butter, for greasing the baking sheets (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Place 4 tablespoons unsalted butter in a large bowl and let sit at room temperature until softened.
Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 375oF. Lightly coat 1 or 2 baking sheets with butter or cooking spray, or line with parchment paper.

Place 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt in a medium bowl and whisk to combine. Beat 2 large eggs in a small bowl with a fork until lightly beaten.
Finely grate the zest of 2 medium or large navel oranges until you have 2 tablespoons. Juice the oranges until you have 1/4 cup juice.

Add the zest to the butter. Beat with an electric hand mixer on medium speed until the butter is well-blended, about 30 seconds. With the mixer still on medium speed, slowly add 1 cup granulated sugar, eggs, and orange juice, and beat until combined, about 20 seconds. Stop the mixer and scrape down the sides of the bowl with a flexible spatula. With the mixer on the lowest speed, slowly add the flour mixture and beat until just combined.

Drop the dough by heaping teaspoonfuls onto the baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart, about 20 per sheet. Bake one sheet at a time until firm on top, light golden-brown on the bottom, and you can just see the browning at the edges, 9 to 10 minutes.

If using greased baking sheets, let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely. If using parchment, slide the parchment with the cookies on it onto a wire rack and let cool completely. Bake the remaining cookies, letting the baking sheets cool completely and re-greasing or lining again with parchment before each batch if reusing.
